    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public static boolean equals​(Object obj1,
                             Object obj2)
        Tests the provided objects for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. If one of the arguments is null and the other is an empty String, array or Collection, this method returns true. Otherwise this method delegates to Objects.deepEquals. This method does not recursively test the elements of arrays and collections: an array with an empty String as the 1st element is not equal to an array with null as the 1st element. Also, an empty array will not be equal to an empty String or an empty Collection.
        Parameters:
        obj1 -
        obj2 -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        StringMethods.isEmpty(Object), ArrayMethods.isEmpty(Object), CollectionMethods.isEmpty(Collection)

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode​(Object obj)
        Generates a hash code for the provided object using using empty-equals-null semantics. That is: null, empty strings, arrays and collections all return 0 (in other words, they all have the same hash code!). The hash code of non-empty arrays will be calculated using Arrays.deepHashCode(Object[]). For any other type of object this method simply calls hashCode() on it.
        Parameters:
        objs -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        StringMethods.isEmpty(Object), ArrayMethods.isEmpty(Object), CollectionMethods.isEmpty(Collection)

      • hash

        public static int hash​(Object... objs)
        Generates a hash code for the provided array of object using using empty-equals-null semantics. See Object.hashCode().
        Parameters:
        objs -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        StringMethods.isEmpty(Object), ArrayMethods.isEmpty(Object), CollectionMethods.isEmpty(Collection)
